Class Blackjack

  • java.lang.Object
    • Blackjack

  • public class Blackjack
extends java.lang.Object
    A program for playing blackjack. Compiling and executing this program will begin a new game through the console.
    Author:
    Paul Lohmuller

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Blackjack.Card
      Card objects are used to determine game progress.
      static class  Blackjack.Rank
      The thirteen card ranks.
      static class  Blackjack.State
      The different states of play in this blackjack game.
      static class  Blackjack.Suit
      The four card suits.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Blackjack()
      This creates an ordered deck of 52 cards, your hand, the dealer's hand, and the discard pile.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkDealer()
      Reduces dealer's Ace weights where necessary.
      boolean checkMe()
      Reduces your Ace weights where necessary.

      Prints the contents of your hand, your score, the dealer's hand, the dealer's score, and the discard pile.

      Play a game of blackjack.

      Randomizes the order of the card deck.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Blackjack

        public Blackjack()
        This creates an ordered deck of 52 cards, your hand, the dealer's hand, and the discard pile. It also initializes your score and the dealer's score to zero.

    • Method Detail

      • shuffleDeck

        public void shuffleDeck()
        Randomizes the order of the card deck.

      • hitMe

        public void hitMe()
        Adds a card to your hand. Also accordingly updates your count.

      • hitDealer

        public void hitDealer()
        Adds a card to the dealer's hand. If the card is the first card, it is also the face-down card. The dealer's score and showing score are accordingly updated.

      • checkDealer

        public boolean checkDealer()
        Reduces dealer's Ace weights where necessary. This method checks the dealer's hand for a bust, and makes any hard Aces into soft Aces.
        Returns:
        false if bust, true otherwise

      • checkMe

        public boolean checkMe()
        Reduces your Ace weights where necessary. This method checks your hand for a bust, and makes any hard Aces into soft Aces.
        Returns:
        false if bust, true otherwise

      • discard

        public void discard()
        Puts all cards from your hand and the dealer's hand into the discard pile. If more than half the deck has been discarded, this shuffles the discard pile back into the deck.

      • printMe

        public void printMe()
        Prints both scores and a table update. Only prints the dealer's face-up cards and score.

      • welcomeMessage

        public static void welcomeMessage()
        A simple welcome text with house rules.

      • debug

        public void debug()
        Prints the contents of your hand, your score, the dealer's hand, the dealer's score, and the discard pile.

      • printResults

        public void printResults()
        Prints the final results of the hand. First it prints the dealer's score and hand, and then it prints your score and hand. It then states who won.

      • updateDealer

        public Blackjack.State updateDealer(Blackjack.State current)
        Advances the dealer's state and evaluates the dealer's hand. This method handles the dealer's state with a switch statement, and applies the appropriate action in each case. Returns the new dealer state which can be the same.
        Parameters:
        current - the dealer's current state
        Returns:
        the dealer's new state, which is either WIN, LOSE, CONTINUE, or STAY.

      • updateMe

        public Blackjack.State updateMe(Blackjack.State current,
                                Blackjack.State dealer)
        Advances your state and evaluates your hand. This method handles your state with a switch statement, and applies the appropriate action in each case. Returns your new state which can be the same.
        Parameters:
        current - your current state
        dealer - the dealer's current state
        Returns:
        your new state, which is either WIN, LOSE, CONTINUE, or STAY.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Play a game of blackjack. This creates a new Blackjack object, your play state, and the dealer's play state. It handles all user interaction through System.in and System.out.
